title: What is grade pay? - Quora
tags: Salaries for Specific Jobs and Careers

response.answer_text: It is the term used In 6th pay Commission Which defines the pay structure The more will be grade pay higher is the rank. In 6th pay commission There were 4 Groups May be you are familier with them:- ■Group “A” Gazetted Officer -5400 or more Posts-DSP,Lieutenant,SDM etc ■Group “B” Non Gazetted -4200,4600,4800 Inspector,SI,J.E, Etc. ■Group “C” Grade Pay 2800 A.S.I,Loco Pilot,TTE etc ■Group “D” Grade pay - 1800 & 2000 Sweeper,Mali,Safai Karamchari,Peon Etc.  Now this Grade pay system is replaced by 7th pay commission. To know how to calculate pay acc to 7th pay commission watch the following video

In the 6 cpc the concept of grade pay was introduced by central government. While condensing so many cadres in the group A, B, C and D the commission introduced grade pay for the respective cadres. While fixing pay the element of grade pay is also reckoned. In the condensed cadre system due to duties and responsibilities devolved on a cadre there was difference in the grade pay component. But For this slight difference the minimum and maximum of the time scale remains the same. Obviously there are anamolies amongst juniors and seniors as latter in some cases get lesser pay than their juniors. Also in the lower cadre some juniors get higher salary than seniors in the higher cadre. This is applicable to pensioners also. Anamoly committee has to look into this early as 7 cpc has come.
